Hymn.Arabic: أَحِبُّوا العَدْلَ يَا قُضَاةَ الأَرضِ، أُذْكُرُوا الرَّبَ بِالصَلاحِ. أُطْلُبُوهُ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
Hymn.Coptic: Menre ;meomhi `nhet ;\ap `e`pka\i> ari `vmeui `m` Po/c/ =en oumetagaqoc > eretenkw; `ncwf =en ;metaplouc nte peten\ht>
Hymn.English: Love righteousness, you who judge on the earth. Think about the Lord in goodness and seek Him with sincerity of heart;
Hymn.Arabiccoptic: مينرى تيمي أومي ني إت تيهاب إبكاهي اري إفميفئي إمبشويس خين أوميت أغاثوس: إري تينكوتي إنثوف خين تيميت ابولوس إنتي بيتينهيت
Hymn.Englishcoptic: Menre ti-me-omi ni-et ti-hap ep-kahi : ari efmevee em-Epchois khen omet-aghathos : ere tenkoti ensof khen timet-aplos ente peten-heet

Hymn.Arabic: فَإنَّمَا يَجِدُهُ الذِينَ لاَ يُجَرِّبُونَهُ، وَيَتَجَلَّى لِلذِينَ لا يَكْفُرُونَ بِهِ
Hymn.English: Because He is found by those who do not tempt Him, and He is manifest to those who do not disbelieve Him.

Hymn.Arabic: لِأنَّ الفِكْرَ الشِرِّيرَ يُقْصِى مِنَ اللهِ، وَقُوَّتُهُ الظَاهِرَةُ تُبَكِّتُ الجُهَّالَ.
Hymn.English: For dishonest reasoning separates people from God, and when His power examines someone, it convicts the undiscerning:

Hymn.Arabic: لِأنَّ الحِكْمَةَ لا تَدْخُلُ فِي نَفْسٍ شِرِّيرَةٍ. وَلا تَحِلُّ فِي جِسْمٍ خَاطِئٍ.
Hymn.English: For wisdom will not enter the soul that plots evil, nor will it dwell in a body involved in sin.

Hymn.Arabic: لِأنَّ رُوحَ الحِكْمَةِ الطَاهِرَ يَهْرُبُ مِنْ كُلِّ غِشٍّ. وَيَبْتَعِدُ عَنْ أَفْكَارِ السُفَهَاءِ وَيُبَكِّتُ الظَالِمَ إذا أقبَلَ
Hymn.English: For a holy spirit of discipline [wisdom] flees from deceit and sends away undiscerning reasoning: it will put wrongdoing to shame when it comes near.

Hymn.Arabic: لِأنَّ رُوحَ الحِكْمَةِ مُحِبٌّ للبَشَرِ. فَلاَ يُبَرِّئُ المُجَدِّفَ بِشَفَتَيْهِ.
Hymn.English: For wisdom is a spirit that loves mankind, but she will punish a blasphemer because of his words;

Hymn.Arabic: لِأنَّ شَاهِدَ كِليَتَاهُ هُوَ اللهُ وَهُوَ الفَاحِصُ الحَقِيقِيُّ لِقَلْبِهِ وَالسَامِعْ لِلِسَانِهِ.
Hymn.English: For God is the witness of his thoughts, the true examiner of his heart, and the hearer of his tongue;

Hymn.Arabic: لِأنَّ رُوحَ الرَبِّ مِلء المَسْكُونَةِ وَبَقِيَّةِ الكُلِّ وَهُوَ يَعْرِفُ أَصْوَاتَ الكُلِّ
Hymn.English: Because the Spirit of the Lord fills the world, and He who holds all things together knows what is said.

Hymn.Arabic: فَلِذَلِكَ لا يَخْفَى عَلَيهِ أَحَدٌ نَاطِقٌ بالظُلْمِ وَلاَيَنْجُو مِنَ الدَينُونَةِ الآتِيَةِ.
Hymn.English: Therefore no one who speaks unrighteous things will escape notice. Nor will justice, when it cross examines, pass him by.
For there shall be a close examination into the deliberations of an ungodly man

Hymn.Arabic: والرَبُّ لا يَسمَعُ لِكَلامِهِ حَتَّى يُظْهِرَ آثَامَهُ.
Hymn.English: And a report of his words will come to the Lord as proof of his lawlessness
